Subject: Global Rights for USB-Sticks do not apply
Description: In our deployment we deny access to USB Storage Device to standard users. However, some special USB-Devices should be allowed to be used on all devices. Therefore we configured Global Rights for these devices (see globalRights.png). Interestingly for the stick with ID 04013DC910CCD36F79DA7593679F9FBDDE0C051D52247197BD4B381C9C7A1B64625300000000000000000000A0DA2FEBFF9A01189155810749AE06B2 this works and it is usable on all devices (works.png). In contrast to that, the stick with ID 0401B71537A572D8A0BDF55361143FC4DB5815A8F8F8D27F970878C91D15F5DBF52100000000000000000000FB2EC82A000D0F189155810749AE010C does not work with global rights (doesntWork.PNG). This stick only works once we set exclipit device rights on a PC (explicitDeviceRights.PNG). As I do not want to add each laptop manually I would like to use the global rights for all USB-sticks.
Solution_Comment__c: The customer confirmed the right is applied correctly.
